identificationModule.briefTitle: Left Atrial Appendage Closure as Secondary Prevention of Atrial Fibrillation-related Embolic Events
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Prospective, Multicenter Clinical Study of Percutaneous Left Atrial Appendage Closure as Secondary Prevention of Atrial Fibrillation-related Embolic Events in Patients With Atrial Fibrillation

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This clinical study is a prospective, multi-center, non-interventional study designed to investigate the safety and effectiveness of percutaneous LAA appendage closure by using LAmbre™ Left Atrial Appendage Occluder System. 579 patients with valvular AF complicated with previous AF-related embolic events (including ischemic stroke, TIA and systemic embolism) were enrolled at about 20 study sites nationwide. The baseline data, operation process and relevant follow-up information of subjects were recorded at 7 months after operation or before discharge and at 1, 3, 6, 12 and 24 months after operation.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Study Population Patients with non-valvular atrial fibrillation and previous AF-related embolic events Purpose To assess the feasibility and safety of percutaneous LAA closure as secondary prevention for patients with non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) and previous atrial fibrillation (AF) related embolic events (including ischemic stroke, transient ischemic attack (TIA), and systemic embolism).

interventions.name: Transthoracic Echocardiography
interventions.description: After the surgey, the tests data will be collected during 8 visits when the subjects go back to the hospital.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of new ischemic stroke, systemic embolism, and cardiac death 12 months after operation
primaryOutcomes.description: Ischemic stroke, systemic embolism, and cardiac death events

primaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of major bleeding events (intracranial or gastrointestinal, or any bleeding requiring transfusion of ≥ 2 units of red blood cells) at 12 months after operation

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Success rate of LAA closure at 3 months after operation
secondaryOutcomes.description: Successful LAA closure was defined as a residual shunt ≤ 3 mm by TEE or ICE after implantation of the LAA occluder.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: The composite endpoint of new ischemic stroke, systemic embolism and cardiac death at 7 months after operation or before discharge and at 1, 3, 6 and 24 months after operation
secondaryOutcomes.description: Ischemic stroke, systemic embolism, and cardiac death events

secondaryOutcomes.measure: (4)Perioperative (7 days after operation or before discharge) surgery-related complications
secondaryOutcomes.description: 7 days after operation or pre-discharge procedure-related complications include but are not limited to stroke (ischemic and hemorrhagic stroke), systemic embolism, allergic reaction, gas embolism, pericardial effusion/cardiac tamponade requiring intervention, occluder detachment, occluder thrombosis (DRT), minor bleeding events (including but not limited to puncture site hematoma, non-major bleeding events), infection, arrhythmia, damage to blood vessels or organs on the implantation path and adjacent organs

Follow-up at 1, 3, 6, 12 and 24 months after operation for procedure-related complications, including all-cause death, stroke (ischemic and hemorrhagic stroke), cardiac perforation, pericardial effusion/cardiac tamponade requiring intervention, major bleeding events (intracranial or gastrointestinal, or any bleeding requiring transfusion of ≥ 2 units of red blood cells), occluder thrombosis (DRT), infection, systemic embolism, allergic reaction, arrhythmia, and other serious cardiovascular events requiring intervention or surgical treatment

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Occluder defects during operation and in the 3rd month after operation
secondaryOutcomes.description: Including but not limited: Occluder displacement, Occluder detachment, Occluder breakage, Occluder damage, etc

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence rate of severe adverse events within 24 months after operation
secondaryOutcomes.description: including but not limited to all-cause death, events requiring hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization, severe endocarditis requiring surgery, pericarditis, cardiac perforation, valvular injury, vascular or gas embolism events, occluder detachment/displacement, occluder fracture, occluder thrombosis (DRT), stroke events

eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients with non-valvular atrial fibrillation and previous AF-related embolic events

locations.facility: The first Affiliated Hospital of WMU
The Second Affiliated Hospital and Yuying Children's Hospital of WMU
